On the machine, there are both gtk versions (i.e. 1.2 and 2.0 libs) are
installed and always found by any application, which requires them.
Which version of Mozilla do you have installed?
See bug 87755 for a similar error when the browser is not set.
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041217
I'm just re-assigning to inbox of more specific component.
David assigned to wrong component - assigning to the correct one.

I've committed this "workaround" code to head. 

If no comment, I'll release for next I-build. 

We'll need verification if this helps/solves the problem 
with workbench not starting (since not reproduced).
*** Bug 87755 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Greetings:

I attached the .log (log.txt) in the previous post.  

Im using build: eclipse.buildId=I20050219-1500

I took a peek at the other bug you refered to but my log doesn't show any
similar trace.  I double checked the configuration settings and "uninstalled"
any stale plugins/features but that did not seem to help.  Let me know what else
I can do to help.  Thanks.
The previous post is for bug 90553.  please disregard.

I'm going to change this to 'fixed' to signify that we think we have a 
partial fix released for our next Milestone (M4). If you still see the 
"won't start" problem there, please re-open. 

There is a possibility that you will still not be able to see preveiw page
with javasccript editor, due to some configuration issue, and if so, would 
suggest you open a other bug for that ... that no, or poor, diagnostics are 
given to help with configuration issues. 

Thanks very much.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.

As component lead, I'm marking this as verified and no longer a problem. If you
ever see again, please open a new bug, referring back to this one.
